kac: Ndai langu si i?
N re.
Dai gaw lamung si re.
Ndai gaw hpa rai?
Dai gaw ma-un si re.
Ma La, kaja ai i?
Kaja ai.
Ma Lu gaw?
Ngai ya gat sa na.
eng: I am going to the market now.

kac: Hkan na i?
Um, hkan na.
Hpa baw mari na rai?
eng: What are you going to buy?
translation: Does your younger sister want to eat rice?

kac: Ngai kanau na labu sa mari na.
eng: I am going to buy a longyi for my little sister.
translation: I really want to see you again.

kac: Ma La, hpa sha na rai?
eng: Ma La, what are you going to eat?
translation: Ma La, did you make your mother happy?

kac: Ngai wa shan shat mai sha na.
eng: I will eat a side dish with pork.
translation: I want to go to the market to buy something.

kac: Ma Lu, nang ma wa shan sha na i?
eng: Ma Lu, are you also going to eat pork?
translation: Mother Lu, where are you going?

kac: N sha ai.
Ngai wa shan shat mai n ra ai.
eng: I don't like a side dish with pork.
translation: I cannot speak Jinghpaw very well.

kac: Hpa shat mai ra ai rai?
eng: What side dish do you need?

kac: U shan shat mai ra ai.
eng: I will have a side dish with chicken.

kac: Ma La, shat sha ngut sai i?
translation: Maria, is the food ready to eat yet?

kac: Sha ngut sai.
N sha shi ai.
Ngai kaw si taw sai.
Dai hku nga, ngai shat jam jaw sha na yaw.
eng: In that case, I will treat you shat jam.
translation: Look, that eagle is very beautiful and also strong, making you admire it.

kac: Kaja i?
Gara kaw ma?
Manang na Jinghpaw shat seng kaw re.
eng: It is at my friend's Jinghpaw restaurant.

kac: Grai sha mu ai.
translation: The dog is chasing the cat.

kac: Gai, hkan nang wa u yaw.
Ngai hpawt de hkawm na.
eng: I will go to travel tomorrow.

kac: Gara de sa na rai?
translation: Is there not a child also with me?

kac: Manmaw de i?
N re. Myitkyina de sa na.
eng: No. I will go to Myitkyina.

kac: Hpa hte sa na rai?
Mawdaw hte i?
Wan leng hte sa na.
Wan leng lekmat ma mari ngut sai.
eng: I have already bought a train ticket.
translation: They just walk and do not play or sit.

kac: Kadai hte sa na rai?
Manang hte i?
Nu yen wa hte rau sa na.
eng: I am going with my parents.
translation: They visited the woods with the dog yesterday.

kac: Ma La na kawa hpa bungli galaw ai rai?
eng: What does Ma La's father do?
translation: Mother, can La see your house from the airplane?

kac: Jawng kaw sara galaw ai re.
eng: He works as a teacher in a school.
translation: I want to study in the future.

kac: Na nu gaw hpa galaw ai rai?
translation: Are you able to find (something) there?

kac: Gat dut ai.
eng: She sells things at the market.

kac: Arung arai amyu myu dut ai re.
eng: She sells a lot of stuff.
translation: The teacher, moreover, has very sharp eyes.

kac: Gara kaw dut ai rai?
translation: Who is the one stealing things?

kac: Hka makau na gat kata kaw re.
eng: At the market near the river.
translation: The river flows down fast and strong.

kac: Anu na seng kaw masha grai sa ai re.
eng: Many people come to my mother's shop.
translation: Anu has intensely begun studying again.

kac: Ma La, nang kaw Japan laika buk nga ai i?
eng: Ma La, do you have a book about Japan?
translation: Ma La, will you be going to Japan?

kac: Nga ai.
Buk kade nga ai rai?
eng: How many books do you have?
translation: What kind of drink do you want?

kac: Buk shi daram nga ai.
Grai law ai i.
Ngai kaw gaw langai sha nga ai.
Gara hku lu la ai rai?
Manang langai Japan kaw na shagun ya ai.
eng: One of my friends sent it to me from Japan.
translation: He/She/They went to Japan for work yesterday.

kac: Nang hti mayu yang ngai ya shap ya na.
eng: I can lend it to you now if you want to read it.
translation: You must now become very like a bride.

kac: Ma Lu, dai ni gara de sa mayu ai rai?
eng: Ma Lu, where do you want to go today?
translation: Ma, Lu, how do you know about this day?

kac: Ngai dai ni Manau wang de sa mayu ai.
eng: I want to go to Manau plaza today.
translation: I might dance at the Manau festival ground today.

kac: Ndai kaw na mawdaw hte sa ra ai i?
eng: Do I need to go there by car?
translation: Do you want to cut and eat this thing?

kac: Mawdaw hte n sa ra ai.
eng: You don't need to go by car.

kac: Dai du hkra nau n tsan ai.
eng: It is not too far to get there.
translation: That thing, you all do not understand.

kac: Lam hkawm mai sa ai.
translation: The road may be closed for good.

kac: Rai tim ya ngai lagaw machyi taw ai.
translation: I went to the rice store to look for a book.

kac: Mawdaw hte mai sa na i?
Mai sa ai.
Dai hku nga mawdaw hte sa ga.
translation: This knife is big and sharp.

kac: Kade jaw ra na rai?
eng: How much do we have to pay?

kac: Hkying lahkawng daram jaw ra ai.
eng: We have to pay about two thousand kyat.
translation: The water is near the road.

kac: Kanau, ndai makau kaw lung seng dut ai seng nga ai i?
eng: Brother, is there a shop that sells jade near here?
translation: Do I collect stones and carry them from this field?

kac: Nga ai le.
Ya lagaw leng pru wa ai shara na makau kaw nga ai.
eng: It is near the place where the bicycle came out just now.
translation: Today, at the festival, there is a singing competition to attend.

kac: Mu ai i?
Um, mu sai, mu sai.
eng: Yes, I see it, I see it.
translation: Yes, the rain is good, the rain is good.

kac: Dai seng kaw lung seng lahkawn dut ai i?
eng: Does the shop sell a jade bracelet?
translation: Is that house bigger than a stone house?

kac: Lung seng lahkawn kaba ra ai re.
eng: I want a big jade bracelet.

kac: Wora seng kaw kaba ai n nga na ngu shadu ai.
eng: I think that shop does not have a big one.
translation: Even though I don't see you playing with the group, I am happy.

kac: Kaji ai gaw nga na re.
eng: It surely has a small one.

kac: Re i?
Hpa rai tim sa yu na re.
translation: The new plan is to request a write-up.

kac: Chyeju kaba sai yaw.
N ra ai law.
Ma Naw tauba si la wa ya ai.
eng: Ma Naw brought us a gourd.
translation: Mr. Naw eats rice and also vegetables.

kac: Tauba si hpe gara hku sha ai rai?
eng: How do you eat a gourd?
translation: How does one make someone eat tiger meat?

kac: Kawa sha ai baw i?
eng: Do you eat it by biting?

kac: N re. Ahpyi sep na sha ai baw re.
eng: No, you eat it by peeling the skin.
translation: I am a woman who is young.

kac: Tauba si gaw kangau sha yang grai mu ai.
translation: Tauba is making me so tired that I am going home now.

kac: Sha mayu yang ya kangau ya na le.
eng: I can fry one for you if you want to eat it.
translation: The relationship between the brother-in-law and the sister-in-law is not just beginning.

kac: Kangau ngut sai.
Chyim yu u le.
Ndai hkri hpa hte kahtawk sha u.
eng: Please eat it with this dipping sauce.
translation: I will work on this day.

kac: Gara hku rai?
Grai mu ai.
Ma Lu, nang Japan sa na wora kaw dut yang kaja ai.
eng: Ma Lu, you had better go to Japan and sell it there.
translation: Ma Lu asked if you have not yet been able to visit Japan.

kac: Grai lu dut na re.
Ngai hpe hkum sharawt tsun.
Ma, dai ni jawng n sa ai i?
eng: Child, don't you go to school today?
translation: Mother, are you not working today?

kac: Dai ni jawng pat ai majaw n sa ra ai.
eng: I don't have to go because the school is closed today.
translation: This road is very straight, therefore it is not difficult.

kac: Awa ma rung n sa ai i?
eng: Dad, don't you go to the office?
